projects.title: Parcels N'at
projects.description:
Parcels N'at provides a single interface to access a diverse set of property and 
housing related datasets across Allegheny County.  Users can explore data parcel-by-parcel,
see region-level indicators of aggregate parcel data, and filter, join and download parcel 
data in bulk.

projects.title: SpaceRAT
projects.description:
The Spatial-Relational Aggregation Toolkit (SpaceRAT) is a python library 
that provides tools to map a colloquial civic tech ontology onto the database
of a regional open data portal with heterogeneous sources and publishers.

projects.title: Greenprint
projects.description:
Winner of a PA [Governor's Award for Environmental Excellence](https://www.dep.pa.gov/About/Awards/EnvironmentalExcellence/Pages/2019-Winners.aspx) in 2019.
Intersectional analysis tool built with Allegheny Land Trust that allows users to map current open spatial data with an environmental focus.  Users can also explore details about parcels.

projects.title: HouseCat
projects.description:
The HouseCat affordable housing catalog provides a user-friendly GIS interface to explore messy data 
from various sources about housing projects in Allegheny County. Access is controlled by a local
affordable housing preservation coalition.

projects.title: WPRDC CKAN Deployment and Theme
projects.description: My work at the Western PA Regional Data Center includes maintaining our CKAN deployment and theme extension.

projects.title: WPRDC App Dev Utilities
projects.description:
Supports the development of the WPRDC website and apps.
Includes React UI components, TypeScript Types, and APIs for interacting with WPRDC backend tools.

projects.title: CKAN Dataspatial extension
projects.description:
A CKAN extension that provides PostGIS support to the CKAN datastore.  
This further supports other GIS operations at the resource-record-level including performing 
spatial queries and serving map tiles.

projects.title: Social Media Election Policies Tracker
projects.description:
The Social Media Election Policy Tracker is a tool built with Pitt Cyber to broadly chronicle a timeline of selected social media
companies’ evolving policies which have impacted the information environment related to U.S. elections and campaigns from 2016 – the present.
